biweekly.io.chain

Class ChainingXmlWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.io.chain.ChainingXmlWriter

  • public class ChainingXmlWriter
extends Object
    Chainer class for writing xCal (XML-encoded iCalendar objects).
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt
    See Also:
    Biweekly.writeXml(Collection), Biweekly.writeXml(ICalendar...)

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • indent

        public ChainingXmlWriter indent(Integer indent)
        Sets the number of indent spaces to use for pretty-printing. If not set, then the XML will not be pretty-printed.
        Parameters:
        indent - the number of spaces in the indent string or "null" not to pretty-print (disabled by default)
        Returns:
        this

      • xmlVersion

        public ChainingXmlWriter xmlVersion(String xmlVersion)
        Sets the XML version to use. Note that many JDKs only support 1.0 natively. For XML 1.1 support, add a JAXP library like xalan to your project.
        Parameters:
        xmlVersion - the XML version (defaults to "1.0")
        Returns:
        this

        value - the property value
